means: 使人欢快的事物（或活动）
Food Education and Service Training 食物教育及服务培训

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"宴会"之意。
means: banquet ： 指正式而盛大的宴会或国宴。
feast ： 指筵席酒席，有时可与banquet换用，但前者强调共享欢乐的气氛。
dinner ： 普通用词，含义广。本义指一日的主餐，但多用于指宴请客人的正式的一餐。
party ： 指一般的社交聚会，也引申指宴请或宴会。

sentence.Network_en: The feast was served by his mother and sisters.
sentence.Network_cn: 这顿美餐是他母亲和他的姐妹们准备的。

sentence.Network_en: Well we did have a midnight feast, me and my sister.
sentence.Network_cn: 我和姐姐的确在半夜大吃了一顿。

sentence.Network_en: On the following day a feast was given in King John's honour.
sentence.Network_cn: 第二天设宴款待约翰王。

jx.jx_en_mean: a person or thing that brings gloom or sadness to an otherwise pleasant or celebratory occasion

jx.jx_cn_mean: 津津有味地看，尽情欣赏

jx.jx_en_mean: either too much of something or too little
To be delighted or gratified by the sight of
jx.jx_cn_mean: 大饱眼福：视觉上得到快乐和满足

lj.lj_ly: We feasted our eyes on the paintings.
lj.lj_ls: 这些画让我们大饱眼福

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French feste (noun), fester (verb), from Latin festa, neuter plural of festus 'joyous'. Compare with fête and fiesta

entry.def: A feast is a large and special meal.

example.ex: Lunch was a feast of meat and vegetables, cheese, yoghurt and fruit, with unlimited wine...
example.tran: 午餐很丰盛，有肉、蔬菜、奶酪、酸奶、水果, 酒无限量供应。

example.ex: The fruit was often served at wedding feasts...
example.tran: 婚宴上经常有水果供应。

entry.tran: 饱餐;尽情地吃;大快朵颐
entry.def: If you feast on a particular food, you eat a large amount of it with great enjoyment.

example.ex: They feasted well into the afternoon on mutton and corn stew...
example.tran: 他们吃玉米炖羊肉一直吃到下午。

example.ex: Starving dogs feasted on the human corpses.
example.tran: 饿狗贪婪地啃食着人的尸体。

entry.def: If you feast, you take part in a feast.

example.ex: Only a few feet away, their captors feasted in the castle's banqueting hall.
example.tran: 仅在几英尺外，捉拿他们的人正在城堡的宴会厅里大吃大喝。

entry.tran: 大量(赏心悦目的事情);盛宴
entry.def: You can refer to a large number of good, interesting, or enjoyable things as a feast of things.

example.ex: This new series promises a feast of special effects and set designs...
example.tran: 这部新的系列剧将会是一场特效和舞美的盛宴。

example.ex: Chicago provides a feast for the ears of any music lover.
example.tran: 《芝加哥》将给所有音乐爱好者献上一场听觉的盛宴。

entry.tran: 宗教节日;宗教节庆时间
entry.def: A feast is a day or time of the year when a special religious celebration takes place.

example.ex: The Jewish feast of Passover began last night...
example.tran: 犹太人的宗教节日逾越节昨晚开始了。

example.ex: At Christmas the visitors began their circuit of dropping in on the eve of the feast day.
example.tran: 圣诞节时，客人们在节日前夜开始逐家拜节。

entry.def: If you feast your eyes on something, you look at it for a long time with great attention because you find it very attractive.

example.ex: She stood feasting her eyes on the view.
example.tran: 她驻足凝神欣赏这片景色。

means.word_mean: 1. a ceremonial dinner party for many people
3. a meal that is well prepared and greatly enjoyed;
1. partake in a feast or banquet
2. provide a feast or banquet for

sentences.sentence: "feed one's eyes on a gorgeous view"

sentences.cn: 他们在帐篷里举行了一次午夜宴会。

sentences.en: Christmas is an important feast for Christians.
sentences.cn: 圣诞节是基督徒的一个重要节日。

sentences.cn: 今朝大吃大喝, 明日忍饥挨饿。

sentences.en: I feasted my friends on my birthday.
sentences.cn: 我生日时宴请了我的朋友们。
